result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Robert Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Fine of $500.00 plus all mandatory costs and surcharges during term of probation.  Bail to apply. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
No contact with victim North Shore Bank or Mo's Irish Pub.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Robert Tucker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:

Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 (two) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
   
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   No contact with victim, North Shore Bank or Mo's Irish Pub. 
     *   Pay $500.00 fine PLUS all mandatory costs and surcharges 
          during the period of probation, cash bail to apply. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due 
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Attempt Theft By Fraud (Value Not Exeeding $2,500) - PTAC, As A Party To A Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(d) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)a), 939.32, 939.05 , a Class A Misdemeanor; received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Donald Robert Tucker in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. . Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Justice Point Program report date June 24, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Donald Robert Tucker in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Program report dated June 18, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Donald Robert Tucker in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea, case transferred from Branch 22 for amendment.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Program report dated May 28, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Donald Robert Tucker in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference, parties wish for global resolution with case# 2005CM007516.  Since this case will be amended to a misdemeanor, Branch 37 has agreed to gloabl resolution in their court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Donald Robert Tucker in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record - court is in trial

Defense request for an adjourned scheduling date allowing time to obain discovery is approved.  Case is adjorned for scheduling conference in Branch 22  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-21-2015 at 01:30 pm.
JUSTICE POINT PRETRIAL REPORT dated 05-04-15 received and filed

Defendant Donald Robert Tucker in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams. Ronald Dague on behalf of Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated April 17, 2015 received and filed. tk

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Donald Robert Tucker in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams. Defendant Donald Robert Tucker in custody. Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Donald Robert Tucker not in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-067

Defendant has a lower number case pending in Branch 37.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/7/15 @ 1:30pm
